collection_metadata.name: FeatBit .NET SDK Testing Collection
collection_metadata.description: Evaluation tests for FeatBit .NET Server SDK integration guidance

test_items.name: dotnet-sdk-aspnetcore-di-basic-setup
test_items.description: Validates that AI can guide developers through setting up FeatBit .NET SDK with dependency injection in ASP.NET Core applications, including proper service registration and configuration.
test_items.input_task_prompt: I have an ASP.NET Core 8 web application. How do I integrate the FeatBit SDK using dependency injection? Show me the complete setup including installing the package and configuring the service.

must_include: Installation command: dotnet add package FeatBit.ServerSdk
should_include: Using IFbClient in controllers or services

evaluation_method.step_1: Extract all package references from response
evaluation_method.step_3: Check for AddFeatBit() extension method reference
evaluation_method.step_5: Confirm code examples use correct C# syntax
evaluation_method.step_6: Check if dependency injection pattern is properly explained

pass_criteria: At least 2 of 4 'should_include' items are present
None of the 'must_not_include' items are present
Code syntax is valid C# for .NET 6+

prerequisites: Access to FeatBit portal for EnvSecret

test_items.name: dotnet-sdk-user-context-authenticated
test_items.description: Validates AI can explain building FbUser objects with custom properties for authenticated users in controller context.
test_items.input_task_prompt: In my ASP.NET Core controller, I need to evaluate a feature flag for authenticated users. How do I create a user context with custom properties like role and subscription level? Show me a complete example with the controller code.

should_include: Multiple Custom() calls for different properties
Example custom properties (role, subscription, country, etc.)
Default value parameter in variation method
must_not_include: Hardcoded user keys in production code

evaluation_method.step_2: Verify user identifier is from authenticated context
evaluation_method.step_3: Confirm at least 2 Custom() calls for properties
evaluation_method.step_6: Verify variation method includes default value

pass_criteria: User context includes meaningful custom properties

prerequisites: ASP.NET Core project with authentication configured

test_items.name: dotnet-sdk-all-variation-types
test_items.description: Validates AI can explain and demonstrate all variation types (bool, string, int, double, JSON) available in FeatBit .NET SDK.
test_items.input_task_prompt: What types of feature flags can I evaluate with FeatBit .NET SDK? Show me examples of all different variation types and when to use each one.

should_include: Use case examples for each type
Explanation of when to use which type

evaluation_method.step_1: Count variation method types mentioned (must be 5)
evaluation_method.step_2: Verify each method has correct signature
evaluation_method.step_3: Check default values are shown for each
evaluation_method.step_4: Validate code examples are syntactically correct
evaluation_method.step_5: Assess if use cases are explained

pass_criteria: All 5 variation types covered (bool, string, int, double, JSON)
Each variation method shown with correct signature
Default values demonstrated for all types
At least 3 use case examples provided

test_items.name: dotnet-sdk-console-app-integration
test_items.description: Validates AI can guide console application integration which differs from ASP.NET Core (no built-in DI).
test_items.input_task_prompt: I have a .NET console application, not an ASP.NET Core app. How do I integrate and use FeatBit SDK without the built-in dependency injection? Show me the complete code.

evaluation_method.step_1: Verify no ASP.NET Core DI patterns used

pass_criteria: None of ASP.NET Core patterns present

test_items.name: dotnet-sdk-error-handling
test_items.description: Validates AI can provide guidance on handling SDK initialization failures and network errors.
test_items.input_task_prompt: My FeatBit SDK initialization is failing with a timeout error. How should I handle SDK initialization errors and what are the best practices for error handling in production?

evaluation_method.step_1: Check if error handling code is provided
evaluation_method.step_4: Evaluate if networking issues are addressed
